text: Eric Paul Cockeram (born 4 July 1924) is a British Conservative Party politician. Originally elected Member of Parliament for Bebington in 1970, Cockeram lost his seat (which he fought unsuccessfully as the renamed Bebington and Ellesmere Port) in the both 1974 general elections. Elected for Ludlow in 1979, he suddenly retired weeks before the 1987 general election following allegations of multiple share applications for British Telecom and British Gas. ==References== *The Times Guide to the House of Commons, Times Newspapers Ltd, 1983 * == External links == * Category:1924 births Category:Living people Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs for English constituencies Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:Members of the Parliament of the United Kingdom for constituencies in Shropshire
title: Eric Cockeram
